episodeTitle: It's Time to Say Goodbye! Leaving Punk Hazard!
episodeTitleJapanese: 惜別の時 パンクハザード出航！
episodeTitleRomanized: Sekibetsu no Toki - Panku Hazādo Shukkō!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates prepare to depart from Punk Hazard after their intense battles and alliance formation. Law explains to Luffy the gravity of their plan to take down Kaido. The G-5 Marines and the rescued children bid an emotional farewell to the crew, with the Marines initially insulting the pirates to hide their true feelings. Law delivers an ultimatum to Doflamingo, demanding he resign from the Shichibukai or face the consequences.

events.title: Law Explains the Four Emperors' Power to Luffy
events.description: In a flashback, Law explains to Luffy the immense power of the Four Emperors (Yonko), mentioning that they once competed against Whitebeard for territory. Law reveals that his plan gives them approximately a 30% chance of defeating Kaido, emphasizing the gravity and danger of their alliance.
events.significance: This moment establishes the stakes of the Straw Hat-Heart Pirates alliance and foreshadows the challenges they will face. It shows Law's strategic thinking and the calculated risk they're taking against one of the world's most powerful pirates.

quotes.text: Don't underestimate the Yonko. They once competed against even Whitebeard for territory. With this plan, we have around a 30 percent chance of defeating Kaido.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law explains the risks of their alliance to Luffy

events.title: Straw Hats Prepare to Leave Punk Hazard
events.description: After the intense battles and alliance formation, the Straw Hat Pirates make final preparations to depart from Punk Hazard. Caesar Clown, Baby 5, and Buffalo are shown chained up and unconscious, ready to be taken as hostages.
events.significance: Marks the end of the Punk Hazard Arc, one of the most significant arcs in the New World saga. The departure sets up the next major arc and the confrontation with Doflamingo.

events.title: G-5 Marines' Bittersweet Farewell
events.description: The G-5 Marines insult and disparage the Straw Hat Pirates as they prepare to leave, blocking the children's view while praising the Marines. However, after the pirates leave, the Marines reveal they spoke badly of the pirates specifically to prevent the children from developing emotional attachments to criminals, showing their conflicted feelings and genuine gratitude.
events.significance: This emotional moment showcases the complexity of justice and morality in One Piece. Despite being on opposite sides, the Marines and Straw Hats developed mutual respect during their time on Punk Hazard. It demonstrates that pirates and Marines aren't simply good vs evil.

quotes.text: You're a disgrace to the Marines! Let the children say their goodbyes!
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Tashigi scolds the G-5 Marines for insulting the Straw Hats

events.title: Children's Emotional Goodbye to the Straw Hats
events.description: The rescued children, including Mocha and Sind, cry and wave goodbye to the Straw Hat Pirates. The children express their gratitude and declare they want to become pirates too when they grow up, much to the G-5 Marines' dismay. The scene emphasizes the impact the Straw Hats had on saving these innocent lives from Caesar's experiments.
events.significance: Highlights the humanitarian side of the Straw Hats' actions and the lasting impact they have on people they help. The children's tearful goodbye and declaration to become pirates shows how the crew inspires others, continuing the cycle of dreams and adventure that defines One Piece.

quotes.text: The Straw Hats tried to save us even though they knew nothing about us! When I grow up, I want to be a pirate too!
quotes.speaker: Sind
quotes.context: Sind expresses his gratitude and admiration for the Straw Hats

events.title: Law's Ultimatum to Doflamingo
events.description: Using the Den Den Mushi, Law contacts Doflamingo and delivers a shocking ultimatum: resign from the Shichibukai position and abandon everything gained over the past ten years, or Law will never return Caesar Clown. Law warns that if Doflamingo quits, the Admirals will hunt him down, but if he refuses, negotiations end and Kaido will come after him for the loss of SMILE production.
events.significance: This is the pivotal moment that sets the entire Dressrosa Arc in motion. Law's ultimatum puts Doflamingo in an impossible position - either lose his Warlord protection or face Kaido's wrath. It demonstrates Law's strategic thinking and his deep understanding of Doflamingo's operations, while also revealing the true extent of Law's revenge plan.

quotes.text: Give up your Shichibukai post. Throw away everything you have gained these past ten years and return to being a normal pirate. Of course, if you do that, the Admirals will hunt you down. You have until tomorrow morning's news. If I see you've retired from the Shichibukai, I'll contact you again. If I see nothing, negotiations are over.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law delivers his ultimatum to Doflamingo

events.title: Doflamingo's Fear of Kaido Revealed
events.description: Upon hearing Law's ultimatum, Doflamingo displays visible fear and fury at the mention of Kaido finding out about the loss of SAD production. His extreme reaction reveals the dangerous power dynamic between Doflamingo and the Emperor Kaido, showing that even a Shichibukai fears the Yonko's wrath.
events.significance: This scene establishes the power hierarchy in the New World and reveals Doflamingo's vulnerability. Despite his confidence and cruelty, Doflamingo is terrified of Kaido, highlighting just how dangerous the Four Emperors are and foreshadowing the massive conflict to come.

quotes.text: Law... you dare threaten me with Kaido?!
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo's furious reaction to Law's ultimatum

events.title: The Alliance Sets Sail from Punk Hazard
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates and Heart Pirates officially depart from Punk Hazard together, sailing toward their next destination as allies. The scene shows both crews on their ships, with Law's submarine traveling alongside the Thousand Sunny, marking the beginning of their joint journey to take down Kaido.
events.significance: This marks the official start of the Straw Hat-Heart Pirate alliance's journey and the end of the Punk Hazard Arc. It's a turning point in the series where Luffy's crew begins actively challenging the established order of the New World by targeting a Yonko.

quotes.text: Don't underestimate the Yonko. They once competed against even Whitebeard for territory. With this plan, we have around a 30 percent chance of defeating Kaido.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law explains the gravity of their plan to Luffy

quotes.text: Give up your Shichibukai post. Throw away everything you have gained these past ten years and return to being a normal pirate.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law

quotes.text: The Straw Hats tried to save us even though they knew nothing about us! When I grow up, I want to be a pirate too!
quotes.speaker: Sind
quotes.context: Sind's farewell to the Straw Hats

themes.description: The episode explores the complex relationship between pirates and Marines, showing that the line between good and evil isn't always clear. The G-5 Marines' conflicted farewell demonstrates mutual respect despite opposing ideologies.
themes.symbolism: The Marines insulting the Straw Hats while protecting the children's innocence symbolizes the complicated nature of justice in the One Piece world.

themes.description: Law's calculated approach to taking down Doflamingo and Kaido showcases the importance of strategic thinking and alliances in the New World. The 30% success rate emphasizes that even with careful planning, challenging the Yonko is incredibly dangerous.
themes.symbolism: The alliance between the Straw Hats and Heart Pirates represents a new era where cooperation is necessary to challenge the established powers.

themes.description: The episode clearly establishes the power structure in the New World, with the Four Emperors at the top. Even a powerful Shichibukai like Doflamingo fears Kaido's wrath, showing the vast gulf between different tiers of power.
themes.symbolism: Doflamingo's fear represents how even the powerful must answer to those stronger, a recurring theme in One Piece's power dynamics.

characterSpotlights.development: Law demonstrates his strategic brilliance by cornering Doflamingo with an impossible ultimatum. His explanation of the Yonko's power shows his understanding of the New World's dangers and his willingness to take calculated risks.
keyActions: Explains the Four Emperors' power to Luffy
Reveals his strategic plan to turn Doflamingo and Kaido against each other
quotes: Don't underestimate the Yonko. With this plan, we have around a 30 percent chance of defeating Kaido.
Give up your Shichibukai post. Throw away everything you have gained these past ten years.

characterSpotlights.development: For the first time, Doflamingo is shown in a vulnerable position. His fear of Kaido and rage at Law's ultimatum reveal that despite his power and confidence, he's trapped between two impossible choices.
keyActions: Displays fear at the mention of Kaido
Must choose between losing Shichibukai status or facing Kaido's wrath
quotes: Law... you dare threaten me with Kaido?!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy learns about the gravity of challenging a Yonko but remains committed to the alliance. His positive impact on the children and Marines shows his ability to change people's perspectives.
keyActions: Learns about the Four Emperors' power from Law
Bids farewell to the children and Marines
Continues the alliance journey toward Dressrosa

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the farewell scene with the G-5 Marines and children, adding more emotional weight and dialogue that wasn't present in the manga.
The flashback of Law explaining the Yonko's power to Luffy is expanded in the anime with additional dialogue about Whitebeard and the Four Emperors.
Doflamingo's reaction to Law's ultimatum is more dramatic and extended in the anime, showing more of his rage and fear.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the official end of the Punk Hazard Arc, which spanned 46 episodes (579-625, excluding episode 590 which was a crossover special).
The opening song 'Hands Up!' by Kota Shinzato was used from episodes 591-628, making this one of the later episodes to feature this opening.
This episode adapts Chapter 697 of the manga, titled 'A Deal'. The chapter title references Law's ultimatum to Doflamingo.
The episode aired on December 1, 2013 in Japan with a TV rating of 8.2%, ranking 3rd in its timeslot.
